Our Mission
PennyEther's mission is to deliver the next generation of blockchain gaming. We're creating a fully autonous Ethereum gaming platform, owned by Token Holders, and offering the most interactive and exciting games on the Ethereum blockchain. Much more information can be found in our whitepaper.
Our Values

Fairness

Our entire platform was built with fairness in mind. All of our games are open sourced, independantly audited, and provably fair.

Penny Auctions:

  • Unlike typical Penny Auction websites, there can be no shill bidding. Bids get distributed to all Token Holders, so there's no way anybody can bid and get their money back - not even the owners.
  • The prize is held in the contact and can only be sent to the winner. It's redeemable the moment the auction has ended.
  • Bids are never wasted -- your bid will be refunded if it doesn't result in you becoming the current winner. This includes the following situations:
    • You are already the current winner
    • The auction ends by the time your bid is mined
    • Somebody else bids after you in the same block
    • You send the wrong amount

InstaDice
  • We use the blockchain for randomness. No third party or oracles are used.
  • Wagers will never be taken unless they can paid on a win.

Transparency

We're open about our contracts, and everything that goes on in our platform.

  • Our contracts are open sourced, tested, and audited
  • View results of prior rolls.
  • View results of prior auctions.
  • View the statuses of our game contracts.

User Experience

We started PennyEther because we were underwhelmed with the state of blockchain gaming. We'll never release a game unless it meets our standards:

  • No Signup: Why should you need to provide any information to play?
  • Wager in Ether: There's no need to exchange Ether for tokens.
  • Interactive UI: The UI will show you what's going on every step of the way -- from your transaction being mined, to the results.
  • Function first, looks second: We'll never sacrifice useful features just to make the UI look cooler. We want to provide our gamers with the information they need to make informed decisions.

Security, Decentralization, and Autonomy

We don't trust anyone, not even ourselves. We've done our best to make PennyEther decentralized, autonomous, and secure -- for both gamers and token holders. For more information on this topic, refer to our whitepaper.
